title: monospaced for personal use
content:
Hey there,

This is a little monospaced Sans Serif I did. At the moment I will just use it for my personal identity to write my letterhead and my bills. But when I have some time I will add an italic and a bolder version. What do you think of it so far? Hope you like it

Best regards. Steven

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [mono-001.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419202953/http:/typophile.com/files/mono-001.pdf) | 62.75 KB |
| [mono Kern King.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419202953/http:/typophile.com/files/mono%20Kern%20King.pdf) | 55.32 KB |
author: stw

comments.content: Very nice! I'd love to see it in a non-monospaced version.

Hi Steven,

So far it looks quite very nice. Maybe the letters e, w, K, M. N, V, W and Y should be a tiny bit thinner. Are you going t add weights?

Cheers  
Boris

Thank you for your comments so far.

Yes I think I will add a non-monospaced version later. And also a bolder version. But unfortunately I don't have much time at the moment because I have to do a lot of work for college. I just wanted to finish this version for my identity at the moment.

Thanks Boris. I will correct the letters as soon as possible.

In the meantime you can take a look at the picture below. It will give you a better view of the actually sizes of the letters and how the look in context...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419202953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Hilt%C3%A4p_6270.jpg)

Cheers. Steven

Hi again Steven,

The letters in context that you just posted certainly look quite elegant. By the way you probably haven't realized that your mono-typeface has to a large extent the look and the feel of the Neo-Humanist typefaces which are quite hot nowadays. I took a look at your homepage, congratulations for the great artwork.

Cheers  
Boris

Thank you Boris :) Glad to hear you like my work.

I updated my font. I think it works better now in text. For testing I set the Kern King by Leslie Cabarga. So what do you think? Better?

Thanks for your help

Cheers Steven

I just made a dotted numeral version. Just to underline the actually amount on the bills.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419202953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dotted_6385.jpg)

Cheers. Steven

I just realised that the pdf totally messed up the outlines. I don't know what happend!? I will upload a right pdf as soon as possible

cheers
the dotted underline is a great idea! i bet it looks awesome on the bills.
